meanings.definition: Having a rough, uneven, or jagged surface.
meanings.sent1: The ruggeder rocks made it difficult to walk along the path.
meanings.sent2: The old tree had a ruggeder bark compared to the young saplings.
meanings.sent3: The ruggeder terrain added an extra challenge to the hiking trail.
meanings.sent4: His voice sounded ruggeder after shouting at the football game.
meanings.sent5: The ruggeder texture of the fabric reminded her of sandpaper.

meanings.sent1: The ruggeder wrestler easily defeated his opponent in the match.
meanings.sent2: Despite the storm, the ruggeder trees stood tall in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The ruggeder attitude of the coach motivated the team to work harder.
meanings.sent4: Her ruggeder personality helped her overcome many obstacles in life.
meanings.sent5: The ruggeder fabric of his jacket kept him warm in the cold winter.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of wear or damage.
meanings.sent1: The ruggeder old car struggled to start in the morning.
meanings.sent2: His ruggeder shoes had holes in the soles from years of use.
meanings.sent3: The ruggeder appearance of the book indicated it had been well-loved.
meanings.sent4: The ruggeder edges of the table showed years of family gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The ruggeder paint on the fence gave it a rustic charm.
